name: Lucas Takes Out the Trash
description:
Lucas Goodman is a lanky, brash, and often exacerbated teenager who has found himself embarking on an important task: taking out the garbage at his grandfather’s pizza place. This mission is not as simple as it seems however, as Lucas’s quest is constantly inhibited by strange individuals of all shapes and sizes. Join Lucas and his friends as they attempt to complete a menial task with far more effort than it’s worth, with the same turn based combat and needlessly verbose dialogue as the first game!

The combat in the first Lucas game was less of traditional combat and more like a series of individual puzzles that players had to solve. The combat in this one is more standard, so I’m interested to see which one people seem to enjoy more.

Features:

  • JRPG Turn Based Combat
  • A slightly less linear progression than the last game
  • Even more naughty words
  • Around an hour of gameplay
  • Occasional need to strategize
  • Voice(?) acting(???)
  • And also more bad hairdos

This is a sequel to the game Lucas and the Casual Acquaintances, and just like in that game if you have any questions, problems, or suggestions feel free to comment them below or email me!

Plugins Used:

  • KockaAdmiralac’s Follow Up Skills
  • Tor Damian Design’s Bind Pictures to Map
  • Himeworks’ Enemy Reinforcements
  • Yanfly’s Core Engine
  • Yanfly’s Message Core
  • Yanfly’s Battle Engine Core
  • Yanfly’s Battle Status Window
  • Yanfly's Quest Journal
